00039 
00040 #ifndef _INTERVAL_H__
00041 #define _INTERVAL_H__
00042 
00043 #include <libcfs/libcfs.h>   /* LASSERT. */
00044 
00045 struct interval_node {
00046         struct interval_node   *in_left;
00047         struct interval_node   *in_right;
00048         struct interval_node   *in_parent;
00049         unsigned                in_color:1,
00050                                 in_intree:1, 
00051                                 in_res1:30;
00052         __u8                    in_res2[4];  
00053         __u64                   in_max_high;
00054         struct interval_node_extent {
00055                 __u64 start;
00056                 __u64 end;
00057         } in_extent;
00058 };
00059 
00060 enum interval_iter {
00061         INTERVAL_ITER_CONT = 1,
00062         INTERVAL_ITER_STOP = 2
00063 };
00064 
00065 static inline int interval_is_intree(struct interval_node *node)
00066 {
00067         return node->in_intree == 1;
00068 }
00069 
00070 static inline __u64 interval_low(struct interval_node *node)
00071 {
00072         return node->in_extent.start;
00073 }
00074 
00075 static inline __u64 interval_high(struct interval_node *node)
00076 {
00077         return node->in_extent.end;
00078 }
00079 
00080 static inline void interval_set(struct interval_node *node,
00081                                 __u64 start, __u64 end)
00082 {
00083         LASSERT(start <= end);
00084         node->in_extent.start = start;
00085         node->in_extent.end = end;
00086         node->in_max_high = end;
00087 }
00088 
00089 static inline void interval_init(struct interval_node *node)
00090 {
00091         memset(node, 0, sizeof(*node));
00092 }
00093 
00094 int node_equal(struct interval_node *n1, struct interval_node *n2);
00095 
00096 /* Rules to write an interval callback.
00097  *  - the callback returns INTERVAL_ITER_STOP when it thinks the iteration
00098  *    should be stopped. It will then cause the iteration function to return
00099  *    immediately with return value INTERVAL_ITER_STOP.
00100  *  - callbacks for interval_iterate and interval_iterate_reverse: Every 
00101  *    nodes in the tree will be set to @node before the callback being called
00102  *  - callback for interval_search: Only overlapped node will be set to @node
00103  *    before the callback being called.
00104  */
00105 typedef enum interval_iter (*interval_callback_t)(struct interval_node *node,
00106                                                   void *args);
00107 
00108 struct interval_node *interval_insert(struct interval_node *node,
00109                                       struct interval_node **root);
00110 void interval_erase(struct interval_node *node, struct interval_node **root);
00111 
00112 /* Search the extents in the tree and call @func for each overlapped
00113  * extents. */
00114 enum interval_iter interval_search(struct interval_node *root,
00115                                    struct interval_node_extent *ex,
00116                                    interval_callback_t func, void *data);
00117 
00118 /* Iterate every node in the tree - by reverse order or regular order. */
00119 enum interval_iter interval_iterate(struct interval_node *root, 
00120                                     interval_callback_t func, void *data);
00121 enum interval_iter interval_iterate_reverse(struct interval_node *root,
00122                                     interval_callback_t func,void *data);
00123 
00124 void interval_expand(struct interval_node *root, 
00125                      struct interval_node_extent *ext,
00126                      struct interval_node_extent *limiter);
00127 int interval_is_overlapped(struct interval_node *root, 
00128                            struct interval_node_extent *ex);
00129 struct interval_node *interval_find(struct interval_node *root,
00130                                     struct interval_node_extent *ex);
00131 #endif
